<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 194, 220, 208]]<|/det|>
# MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 216, 304, 232]]<|/det|>
Paper 5 Mechanics 2 (M2)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 260, 460, 303]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Answer Booklet/Paper Graph Paper List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 320, 390, 337]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 352, 828, 367]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 368, 722, 383]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 384, 325, 399]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 400, 495, 415]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 416, 601, 432]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 447, 284, 462]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 463, 907, 494]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 494, 720, 510]]<|/det|>
Where a numerical value for the acceleration due to gravity is needed, use \(10 \text{m s}^{- 2}\) .  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 510, 590, 525]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 526, 606, 542]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 556, 606, 572]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 572, 756, 588]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 588, 440, 604]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 605, 907, 635]]<|/det|>
Questions carrying smaller numbers of marks are printed earlier in the paper, and questions carrying larger numbers of marks later in the paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[368, 82, 668, 262]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 280, 920, 316]]<|/det|>
A uniform rod \(AB\) of weight \(16 \mathrm{N}\) is freely hinged at \(A\) to a fixed point. A force of magnitude \(4 \mathrm{N}\) acting perpendicular to the rod is applied at \(B\) (see diagram). Given that the rod is in equilibrium,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 322, 141, 341]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 322, 584, 341]]<|/det|>
calculate the angle the rod makes with the horizontal,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 322, 920, 341]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 346, 151, 365]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 346, 707, 365]]<|/det|>
find the magnitude and direction of the force exerted on the rod at \(A\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 348, 920, 365]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 392, 92, 411]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 392, 920, 444]]<|/det|>
A uniform lamina \(ABCD\) consists of a semicircle \(BCD\) with centre \(O\) and diameter \(0.4 \mathrm{m}\), and an isosceles triangle \(ABD\) with base \(BD = 0.4 \mathrm{m}\) and perpendicular height \(h \mathrm{m}\). The centre of mass of the lamina is at \(O\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 457, 153, 475]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 457, 316, 475]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(h\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 457, 920, 475]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 486, 151, 504]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 501, 692, 732]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 752, 920, 787]]<|/det|>
The lamina is suspended from a vertical string attached to a point \(X\) on the side \(AD\) of the triangle (see diagram). Given the lamina is in equilibrium with \(AD\) horizontal, calculate \(XD\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 768, 920, 787]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[237, 82, 798, 214]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 234, 920, 285]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) of mass \(0.5 \mathrm{kg}\) is attached to the vertex \(V\) of a fixed solid cone by a light inextensible string. \(P\) lies on the smooth curved surface of the cone and moves in a horizontal circle of radius \(0.1 \mathrm{m}\) with centre on the axis of the cone. The cone has semi-vertical angle \(60^{\circ}\) (see diagram).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 297, 154, 315]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 297, 920, 330]]<|/det|>
Calculate the speed of \(P\), given that the tension in the string and the contact force between the cone and \(P\) have the same magnitude.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 316, 920, 333]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 343, 154, 361]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 343, 833, 361]]<|/det|>
Calculate the greatest angular speed at which \(P\) can move on the surface of the cone.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 344, 920, 363]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 389, 94, 406]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 388, 920, 439]]<|/det|>
One end of a light elastic string of natural length \(0.5 \mathrm{m}\) and modulus of elasticity \(12 \mathrm{N}\) is attached to a fixed point \(O\). The other end of the string is attached to a particle \(P\) of mass \(0.24 \mathrm{kg}\). \(P\) is projected vertically upwards with speed \(3 \mathrm{m} \mathrm{s}^{- 1}\) from a position \(0.8 \mathrm{m}\) vertically below \(O\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 452, 154, 470]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 452, 836, 470]]<|/det|>
Calculate the speed of the particle when it is moving upwards with zero acceleration.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 452, 920, 470]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 483, 153, 501]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 483, 920, 500]]<|/det|>
Show that the particle moves \(0.6 \mathrm{m}\) while it is moving upwards with constant acceleration.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 483, 920, 501]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 530, 94, 548]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 528, 920, 578]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) of mass \(0.4 \mathrm{kg}\) moves in a straight line on a horizontal surface and has velocity \(\nu \mathrm{m} \mathrm{s}^{- 1}\) at time \(t\) s. A horizontal force of magnitude \(k \sqrt{\nu} \mathrm{~N}\) opposes the motion of \(P\). When \(t = 0\), \(\nu = 9\) and when \(t = 2\), \(\nu = 4\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 593, 153, 612]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 592, 688, 622]]<|/det|>
Express \(\frac{\mathrm{d}\nu}{\mathrm{d}t}\) in terms of \(k\) and \(\nu\), and hence show that \(\nu = \frac{1}{4} (t - 6)^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 594, 920, 613]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 631, 153, 650]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 631, 693, 650]]<|/det|>
Find the distance travelled by \(P\) in the first 3 seconds of its motion.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 632, 920, 650]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 677, 96, 695]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 677, 920, 711]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) is projected with speed \(26 \mathrm{m} \mathrm{s}^{- 1}\) at an angle of \(30^{\circ}\) below the horizontal, from a point \(O\) which is \(80 \mathrm{m}\) above horizontal ground.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 725, 153, 743]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 725, 688, 743]]<|/det|>
Calculate the distance from \(O\) of the particle \(2.3 \mathrm{s}\) after projection.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 725, 920, 744]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 756, 153, 774]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 756, 730, 774]]<|/det|>
Find the horizontal distance travelled by \(P\) before it reaches the ground.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 756, 920, 774]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 787, 153, 805]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 787, 925, 805]]<|/det|>
Calculate the speed and direction of motion of \(P\) immediately before it reaches the ground.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 787, 920, 805]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]
